Context:
Program Name: Electrical Techniques
Code: T167
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Duration: 1 year (2 semesters)
Starting Months: May
Domestic Tuition: $5,035.00
International Tuition: $17,584.00
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Method of Study: Full-time
Program Description: A 1-year program focusing on electricity and electronics for residential and commercial electrician applications, covering installation, testing, maintenance, analysis and troubleshooting of electrical systems under supervision of a qualified person. Applicable to domestic students only.
Graduates: Receive a post-secondary certificate.
Career & Postgraduate Study Opportunities: Increases marketability and knowledge of the electrical industry; potential for continuing on to a two-year or three-year program at George Brown College.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Electrical Techniques Program T167 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Extracted Information:

1. George Brown College offers a two-year or three-year program for Skilled Trades.
2. Construction industry is one of the largest employers in Canada with skilled trades workers being among the highest paid and most in-demand.
3. Semester 1 required courses: ELCL 1047, ELCL 1048, ELCL 1049, ELCL 1050, ELCL 1051, COMM 2000.
4. Semester 2 required courses: ELCL 1057, ELCL 1058, ELCL 1059, ELCL 1060, ELCL 1061.
5. Program Learning Outcomes:
   - Assist in interpreting and preparing electrical drawings and related documents.
   - Analyze and solve simple technical problems related to basic electrical systems.
   - Use and maintain test and instrumentation equipment.
   - Assemble basic electrical circuits and equipment.
   - Assist in the installation and troubleshooting of basic electrical machines and control systems.
   - Assist in testing and troubleshooting electrical and electronic circuits, equipment, and systems.
   - Assist in troubleshooting control systems.
   - Use computer skills to solve basic electrical-related problems.
   - Conduct quality assurance procedures.
   - Install and test telecommunication systems.
   - Apply health and safety standards and best practices to workplaces.
   - Perform tasks in accordance with relevant legislation, policies, procedures, standards, regulations, and ethical principles.
   - Install and test system grounding for various applications under supervision.
   - Identify problems and troubleshoot electrical systems under supervision.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Electrical Techniques Program T167 | George Brown College2023.txt

Program Information:

Tuition and Fees:
- Domestic Tuition for the first two semesters: $5,035.00 *
- International Tuition for the first two semesesters: $17,584.00 **
- Amounts are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates.

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent is required
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Grade 11 math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U)
- Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and math, or consider upgrading to achieve the credit(s) needed in math.
- George Brown College is committed to ensuring that applicants will succeed in their program of choice and meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program. Applicants may be required to have grades higher than the minimum requirements stated.
- International Students are advised to visit the International Admissions page for more information regarding country-specific admission requirements.
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, and international students should visit the How to Apply page for application information.

* Amount listed is for programs starting in Fall 2022
** Amount listed is for programs starting in Fall 2023

Context:
International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For more information on how and when to apply, visit the "How to Apply" page.

Contact Information for School of Apprenticeship and Skilled Trades:
- Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 6711
- Email: skilledtrades@georgebrown.ca
- Room: Casa Loma Campus, Room E308

George Brown College Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.

International students can contact a recruitment representative by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the "International Contact Us" page.

Campus Tours and Information Sessions: Sign up for an information session, explore related programs (Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146), Construction Techniques (T176), Plumbing Techniques (T165)), and book a campus tour or get answers to questions by booking an info session.

To apply, international students must provide their first name, last name, email address, and indicate whether they are domestic or international students, as well as their country of origin. They need to agree to receive email communications from George Brown College and can unsubscribe at any time.
